item.title: Why are there so few women in science?

item.title: Emmy Noether
item.description: While I was reading about the Translation operator today, I stumbled upon the wiki for Emmy Noether - famous for “Noether’s theorem” which tells us that conservation laws follow from the symmetry properties of nature. It was interesting to note that she had worked at a German institute for seven years without pay because at that time(~1910), women were largely excluded from academic positions. This was comforting to me because I was feeling sad about the fact that I only started learning CS after I started my undergrad.

item.title: Shifting my site
item.description: Hey folks, I thought about this a lot and finally have decided to shift my blog to Jekyll based Github pages due to a couple of reasons: It’s completely free(until a limit of 1GB is reached). Yeah, wordpress is free but it serves ads and as everybody knows, ads suck. I bought a domain name for myself - aravindreddy.org and it seems like this is the best time for me to make a switch.

item.description: Today, I came across a very interesting article on Wikipedia: Relative age effect. It looks like I have been positively affected by it(I was born in July and school sessions generally start in June in India) and I’m sorry for the millions of people negatively affected by it.
